intro: Hieracium callianthoides, commonly known as the clustered hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer, and its leaves are usually lance-shaped with a rough texture. Hieracium callianthoides is often considered a weed but can be found in various habitats across its native range.
